article.headline: Canisius 67, St. Bonaventure 61
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) -- Dewitt Doss had 15 points and Kevin Downey added 13 to help lift Canisius to a 67-61 victory over St. Bonaventure Saturday night. Chuck Harris contributed 12 points for the Griffins, who snapped a four-game losing streak dating back to last year. They won for only the second time in the last eight games. Down by two at the half, Canisius (1-1) stormed back with a 22-4 run capped by a Harris jumper to take a 52-38 lead with less than nine minutes remaining. The Bonnies trimmed the deficit to five with less than a minute to go, but were unable to get any closer. St. Bonaventure (0-3) was led by Patrick Lottin's 21 points. Wade Dunston added 10 points and Ahmad Smith had 10 rebounds for the Bonnies, who have started the season with three consecutive losses for the first time since 1994-95.
